subject: [Bad?] mint.com may change the terms at any time, but will display a change date
text:
"Intuit may modify this Agreement from time to time. Any and all changes to this Agreement will be posted on the Mint.com site. In addition, the Agreement will always indicate the date it was last revised. You are deemed to accept and agree to be bound by any changes to the Agreement when you use the Service after those changes are posted."
https://github.com/tosdr/tosback2/blob/265e49bf24a91076495ce1fddf279c4638421a66/crawl/mint.com/Terms%20of%20Use.txt#L221

it would be nice if they would send out pro-active alerts when the terms change, and give some lead time to allow you to leave the service if you don't accept the new terms, but at least they commit to always display a latest change date, which is already more than a lot of other services do.
